alert.note: Alert for Avery; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 4:28AM EST until January 09 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of one to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...The northern mountains and adjacent foothills of North Carolina, mainly near the Blue Ridge Escarpment north of Interstate 40. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Ice accumulations may combine with the very windy conditions to cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Flood Watch remains in effect through the day, as does a High Wind Warning at elevations above 3500 feet and a Wind Advisory below 3500 feet through early evening.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for freezing rain means that periods of freezing rain or freezing drizzle will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a message with your observation and the specific location where it occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook or tweet your report using hashtag nwsgsp. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of weather information for the latest updates. Additional details can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp. The latest state road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey
